report_title: Online Used Book Sales in the US
executive_summary: The COVID-19 outbreak accelerated the industry's growth due to increased online sales and extra leisure time encouraging more reading. The rapid rise in e-commerce contributed to growth as online shopping grew popular due to better internet and increased smartphone usage. However, the burgeoning popularity of e-books posed a challenge. Overall, industry revenue grew at a CAGR of 5.8% to $3.4 billion over the past five years. Moving forward, demand for old, rare or out-of-print books and the rise of online book clubs will stimulate growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The outbreak of COVID-19 significantly accelerated growth as physical stores closed and people had more leisure time, driving demand for online used book sales.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Continued Rise of E-Commerce Has Driven Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The growth of e-commerce positively affected the industry as improved internet and increased smartphone usage boosted online shopping and demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Remains Relevant Despite Competition From E-Books
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: E-books posed a challenge but many consumers still prefer physical books. Used books offer affordability and rare titles, maintaining industry relevance.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand For Niche And Out-Of-Print Books Will Support Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Increasing demand for old, rare or out-of-print books from readers and collectors will support industry growth over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Rise of Online Book Clubs and Communities
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Online book clubs influencing reading trends and choices will drive demand for certain titles and promote sharing/selling used books.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Navigating the Double-Edged Sword of Digitization Will Be Key
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While digitization presents opportunities, the shift towards digital reading could lead to declining demand for physical used books.

industry_definition: Operators in the Online Used Book Sales industry sell used books on e-commerce marketplaces. The industry includes sale of used trade, education, professional, religious books and any other used book sold online.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady Barriers To Entry Level

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Internet traffic volume

key_trends: The COVID-19 outbreak accelerated industry growth.
The continued rise in e-commerce and online book clubs will support revenue growth.
Online used book retailers must adhere to common labor and safety regulations.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes book retailers and other used good retailers. Book retailers and other used goods retailers often leverage online used book retailers to diversify their own product offerings.

This market segment includes public and private schools, colleges and universities. This is the largest market for the industry. Within this segment, public schools and community colleges account for the largest share of industry revenue.

Both public and private schools, colleges and universities deal with limited budgets for resources, including books. The high costs of new textbooks make online used book retailers an appealing alternative. The significant price difference, coupled with the convenience of delivery, drives demand for online used book retailers.

This market segment includes book retailers and other used good retailers. Book retailers and other used goods retailers often leverage online used book retailers to diversify their own product offerings.

products_and_services.product_description: This product segment includes used hardback and paperback trade books. Trade books encompass a broad range of books for general readership, including children's, young adult, fiction and non-fiction books.

Trade books appeal to a wide range of readers. This broad appeal makes them highly sought-after in the used book market, from students looking for affordable text to avid readers seeking out-of-print classics or simply functioning as an affordable source of entertainment.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Used Primary and Secondary School Books
products_and_services.product_description: This product segment is made up of used educational books including both higher education and primary and secondary education books.

The cost of new textbooks, particularly for higher education, has been on a steady rise over the years. This has caused many students and educational institutions to opt for used books which are significantly cheaper. The switch to used books is prevalent both among primary and secondary students and higher education learners.

Sales of used professional books are driven by the ongoing need for professionals to stay updated, meet continuing education requirements or change careers. The high costs of new books make the online used books market an attractive, cost-effective source for consumers.

tier_2_suppliers: Book, Magazine & Newspaper Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: An increase in the time spent on leisure and sports represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

basis_points.basis_title: Online used book retailers compete based on price, product selection and customer service.
basis_points.basis_description: Operators that are able to offer competitive pricing or rare books attract customers.
The popularity of e-books has posed a threat to the industry. The expanding range of e-books available attracts consumers who are looking for instant satisfaction.

concentration_points.concentration_description: There are no major players in this industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the largest cost for online used book retailers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The acquisition of books, which involves buying used books from various sources, is essential for maintaining and updating inventory. This high-volume purchasing forms the primary expenditure for businesses in the industry.

Even as an online industry, employees are still required for several operative tasks. These include management, customer service, order processing, book procurement and other day to day tasks. Online used book retailers can also differentiate themselves by hiring knowledgeable employees that have valuable insights on the book inventory. This allows them to provide quality customer service and generate customer loyalty.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower. However, the concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served my incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Online used book sales are majorly influenced by changing consumer preferences and trends. If the demand for certain titles or genres falls, used book sellers may have a surplus of unwanted books, leading to price volatility and reduced profitability.

volatility_points.volatility_title: E-books and consumer free time affect volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: When more technically advanced e-book platforms are introduced, it threatens the traditional used book market. A sudden preference shift towards these platforms can change the demand for physical copies, leading to fluctuations in sales.

FAQs.question: How do you organize your stock? Have you had any issues in the past regarding low inventory?
FAQs.answer: Since purchased inventory is the most significant industry expense, the ability to facilitate turnover is crucial for success.

FAQs.question: What kind of experience and knowledge does your work force require? Have you had any past issues with a less experienced work force?
FAQs.answer: To satisfy customers, operators need to have staff who have relevant knowledge of the products currently being sold.

FAQs.question: How are you able to provide superior after sales service?
FAQs.answer: Operators should provide superior after-sales service, including shipment tracking, offering refunds and exchanges and establishing new shopping platforms as technology evolves.

FAQs.question: Do you track the level of disposable income? How do you plan to mitigate the threat of decreasing per capita disposable income?
FAQs.answer: Industry demand typically increases during periods of disposable income growth, since more consumers can afford product purchases.

FAQs.question: How do you plan to convince consumers to spend leisure time consuming your product? How can you advertise to specific audiences to increase demand?
FAQs.answer: Apart from its educational benefits, reading is generally considered to be a leisure activity.

FAQs.question: Do you track internet connectivity levels? How many of your clients provide online content primarily?
FAQs.answer: As an e-commerce industry, operators benefit from increased internet traffic volume since it generally translates to higher sales volumes.
